rules.text: Wetland restoration projects eligible when activities convert degraded wetlands to forest and meet small-scale thresholds.
Definitions clarify wetland geomorphology, participant aggregation, and leakage belt concepts.
Project boundary includes on-site hydrological interventions and relevant carbon pools except where justified.
Baseline assumes continuation of pre-project wetland degradation with zero additional removals.
Project removals calculated from pool carbon stock changes minus emissions from project operations.
Leakage from displaced wetland uses monitored and deducted using Tool 14 defaults.
Monitoring plan covers hydrology restoration, vegetation plots, and participant reporting.
Data tables specify default biomass factors, hydrological parameters, and monitoring records.
Uncertainty analysis follows Tool 12 with deductions when precision thresholds unmet.
Permanence buffer contributions determined via Tool 15 wetland risk factors.
Normative tools and references maintained for monitoring and verification teams.
Annualized carbon stock change derived from difference in pool carbon divided by measurement interval.
Annexes capture hydrology restoration evidence, training records, and community engagement notes.
